children.subject: On cal central, stat 154 is enforcing the stat 135 prerequisite, a class that some of us haven't taken :(
Yes I and many other ds majors have not taken stat 135
oof I hadn't realized that class enforces pre-requisites :(

Email Prof. Sanchez and see if he can give you an enrollment permission code into the class. If you can explain that you have sufficient preparation for the class, I'd like to think that he would let you in given the circumstances. gaston.stat@gmail.com

If you'd like to reference a past stat 154 that he's taught look here: https://github.com/ucb-stat154/stat154-spring-2018

From my quick look, a lot of this stuff should be familiar if you've taken linear algebra and data 100---really until the halfway point of the course, the only thing that I don't remember covered at all in either of those courses is the idea of multicollinearity. So long as you're willing to pick up R, you should have no trouble understanding the course.
Tried emailing and got an auto-response. He's out of town with limited internet access :(
Nothing too add but say how terrible you were dropped. That sucks :/ Any justification/explanation?
The email just mentioned "due to hiring constraints." It might be related to the hiring drama going on at the eecs dept.

Stat154 is still open (only half full) if you really need to graduate. 

But I am too very frustrated I was dropped from this waitlist, as I also really wanted to take 182. 

I am also shifting my schedule around now so I can graduate.

Same issue, seeing that other ML courses are either full/waitlisted and same issue of TA hiring constraints other than 154 (which may not allow due to prerequisites) what can graduating seniors expect to take?

history.content: I as well as many Data Science seniors did phase 1 for cs 182L and cs 182W and added other classes I needed to graduate as well. However they just sent out an email dropping everyone from the waitlist. Unfortunately even during phase 2 all the other ML requirement classes were full. I planned everything out since phase 1 and there's no way I could have foreseen getting dropped from both these courses to prevent me from graduating. It's frustrating that Data Science seniors can't graduate because we wanted to study Neural Networks and had no warning about this potentially happening.
history.subject: Dropped from CS182L and W182, needed to graduate
